Tips Otomotif
Mendeteksi Kerusakan Gran Max 1.5L dan Luxio
02 Nov 2019, 09:47 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Komponen connecting rod atau 'stang seher' yang harus diganti. (Foto: CNN Indonesia/ Rayhand Purnama)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- PemilikÂ Daihatsu Gran Max 1.5L dan Luxio bisa mendeteksi kerusakan mesin. Gejala biasanya bakal muncul di awal pada bagian mesin yang mengeluarkan suara 'aneh'.Astra Daihatsu Motor (ADM) sudah melakukan penarikan kembali atau recall pada dua mobil tersebut karena cacat produksi connecting rod atau 'stang seher'. Komponen itu disebut riskan patah.Sudah lima mobil mengalami mesin mati saat jarak tempuh di atas 10 ribu km akibat rusaknya komponen itu. Sedangkan satu mobil lainnya hanya mengeluarkan bunyi tidak normal. Perlu dipahami 'stang seher' pada mesin berguna untuk menghubungkan piston dengan crank shaft.Technical Services Division Head ADM Anjar Rosjadi mengatakan tanda mesin mengalami kerusakan bisa diketahui dari suara aneh keluar dari ruang mesin saat mobil bergerak."Kalau pelanggan jalan di jalan normal (rata) itu akan bisa menimbulkan suara berisik. Lalu kemudian mesin akan mati," kata Anjar di Sunter, Jakarta Utara, Jumat (1/11).Hal tersebut, menurut Anjar juga berlaku saat mobil menghadapi jalan menanjak dan menurun. Semua diawali dengan suara berisik dari jantung penggerak.Namun kata dia pengemudi harus waspada ketika berada di jalan menurun. Sebab saat kondisi mesin mendadak mati, praktis tidak akan ada engine brake untuk membantu pengereman, sementara sistem rem tidak akan berfungsi normal di saat mesin dalam kondisi mati.Dari hasil investigasi Daihatsu, untuk kasus mesin mendadak mati setelah bunyi berisik saat mobil menempuh kecepatan 40 km per jam hingga 60 km per jam.Head Product Improvement ADM Bambang Supriyadi mengatakan suara mesin akibat stang seher yang rusak sangat mengganggu. Jadi sangat mudah dibedakan antara bunyi mesin rusak dan berjalan normal."Bunyinya gitu 'tektektek', berisik lah. Bunyi itu tidak seperti bunyi mesin normal," ujar Bambang.Menurut Bambang berdasarkan kasus yang dialami konsumennya, mesin mobil akan bermasalah setelah mobil menempuh jarak lebih dari 10 ribu kilometer."Jadi ada yang sudah 14 ribu km lalu bunyi mesinnya. Satu minggu kemudian atau digunakan sejauh 800 sampai 1.000an km, mesin bakal mati mendadak," ucap Bambang.Baiknya, konsumen segera membawa mobilnya ke bengkel resmi dan tidak perlu menunggu sampai mesin mengeluarkan suara aneh."Jadi seandainya konsumen mengalami masalah di jalan terkait hal ini bisa menghubungi bengkel Daihatsu terdekat agar segera bisa membantu konsumen," tutup Anjar. (ryh/mik)

Automotive Tips
Detect Gran Max 1.5L and Luxio Damage
02 Nov 2019, 09:47 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Connecting rod components or 'handlebar piston' that must be replaced. (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Rayhand Purnama)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The owner of Daihatsu Gran Max 1.5L and Luxio can detect engine damage. Symptoms will usually appear at the beginning on the part of the engine that makes a 'strange' sound. The Daihatsu Motor (ADM) has already made a recall or recall of the two cars because of the defect of connecting rod or 'handlebar piston'. The component is called broken risk. Five cars have experienced a dead engine when the mileage is above 10,000 miles due to damage to that component. Whereas one other car only made an abnormal sound. It should be understood 'handlebar seher' on the engine is useful for connecting the piston with the crank shaft. Technical Services Division Head ADM Anjar Rosjadi said the engine sign was damaged can be known from a strange noise coming out of the engine room when the car is moving. "If customers walk on normal roads (flat "It will cause noise. Then the engine will turn off," Anjar said in Sunter, North Jakarta, Friday (1/11). According to Anjar, this also applies when the car faces an uphill and downhill road. It all starts with a noise from the heart of the propulsion. But he said the driver must be vigilant when he is on a downhill road. Because when the engine condition suddenly turns off, there will be practically no engine brakes to assist braking, while the brake system will not function normally when the engine is turned off. per hour up to 60 km per hour. ADM Head Product Improvement Bambang Supriyadi said the engine noise due to the broken handlebar is very disturbing. So it is very easy to distinguish between the sound of a broken engine and normal operation. "It sounds like 'tektektek', it's noisy. The sound is not like the sound of a normal engine," said Bambang. "So there are already 14 thousand km and then the engine sounds. One week later or used as far as 800 to 1,000 km, the engine will die suddenly," said Bambang. The good, consumers immediately bring their cars to the official workshop and not need to wait until the engine makes a strange noise. "So if consumers experience problems on the road related to this matter, they can contact the nearest Daihatsu workshop so they can immediately help consumers," concluded Anjar. (ryh / mic)
